longInfo:
Passport required.
- Nationals of Germany are allowed to enter with expired (max.
  1 year) passports, national ID cards, ID cards for children
  ("Kinderausweis") or temporary passports. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of a National ID Card issued to nationals of
  Germany.
- Holders of a valid Temporary National ID Card issued to
  nationals of Germany.
- Holders of a Temporary passport ("Vorlaeufiger Reisepass")
  issued by Germany.
- Holders of an identity document ( Kinderausweis ) issued by
  Germany to minors up to/incl. 15 years of age. Photograph is
  not required for children up to/incl. 10 years of age.

Visa required, except for A max. stay of 90 days for nationals
of Germany.
Minors:
- Up to/incl. 18 years of age may be included in parent's
  passport. 
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of Germany will be expected to
  hold their own passport or National ID Card (where
  applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus,
  Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
Additional Information:
- If it appears from the documents of a non-Turkish passenger
  that their original nationality was Turkish,
   
- A max. stay of 90 days is granted within a 180 day period to
  nationals of Germany
vaccination:
Vaccinations not required.

Recommended:
- Malaria prophylaxis. malaria risk, exclusively due to P.
  vivax, is very low - exists from May to October in the
  provinces of Diyarbakir, Mardin and Sanliurfa. There is no
  malaria risk in the main tourist areas in the west and
  south-west of the country. Recommended prevention in risk
  areas: A.
